alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Grady; Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 19 at 3:24AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Gadsden, southeastern Decatur, Grady and northwestern Thomas Counties through 400 AM EDT... At 323 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Whigham, or 11 miles north of Havana, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Havana, Cairo, Quincy, Thomasville, Ochlocknee, Whigham, Attapulgus, Climax, Freemont, Littman, Capel, Darsey, Florence, Scotland, Jamieson, Rocky Hill, Laingkat, Calvary, Santa Clara and Shady Rest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
